summary: A simple recolor in satin black of the beautiful Mavari Armor by Zerofrost. Female only!
descriptionHtml:
[center]
[img]http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5503/9368112610_78483d6409_o.png[/img]
[size=4][i]Any colour - so long as it\'s black.[/i][/size]
[size=1]Henry Ford[/size]

[img]http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7320/9368112226_9320e4192f_o.png[/img]
[size=2]Yes, I\'ve done it. 
Here is my retexture of the beautiful unique Mavari Armor by Zerofrost. 
It is plain black, with silver metal pieces. 
I really tried to preserve all those great details on the leather, 
and I publish this mainly for those, who ask me to share this and I am pretty happy now that I can!
So don\'t hold back and enjoy! :)[/size]
[size=3][b]TWO VERSIONS AVAILABLE NOW: 2k and 4k[/b][/size]
[size=2]Sidenote 2: in some light the color looks actually greenish. There is really not much I can do about it :/ [/size]

[youtube]xJPmlys5VoI[/youtube]
[size=1]Thanks so much for the great video![/size]

[size=2][img]http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7444/9368112164_e7d5a3d9fb_o.png[/img]
1. First install the main armor mod, if you haven\'t already : [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38386//?]MAVARI ARMOR BY ZEROFROST[/url]
2. Install the retexture with NMM or manually.
a) with NMM ... easy as it is! Click yes to all overwriting questions.
b) manually: copy the files from the Mavari folder and paste them into your own -> Data -> textures -> armor -> Mavari, 
say yes to overwriting.
3. Enjoy :)

Deinstallation or changing back to the old: easy way with NMM. 
Manually you first have to get the files from Zerofrosts original and let them overwrite the retexture again.

If you have any issues, please let me now as this is my first mod published ever. 


[img]http://farm6.staticflickr.com/5499/9368111966_911a434491_o.png[/img]
Yes, you might ask for a particularly color. I will decide if I try a recolor or not. 


[img]http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7365/9365330451_9521fd40a8_o.png[/img]
All credits go to Zerofrost, for making this beautiful piece of art. 
Thank you very very very much for letting me publish this!


[img]http://farm3.staticflickr.com/2841/9368112044_d1c103f5f5_o.png[/img]
Please don\'t upload my retexture on any other homepage or hoster.
If that happens, this will be my first and my last published retexture.[/size][/center]
author: Caelrya
